isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - SPECIAL SERVICE TOOLS - DELUXE RECOVERY/RECYCLING STATION

svcproc.title: DELUXE RECOVERY/RECYCLING STATION
svcproc.para: The Deluxe Recovery/Recycling Station (OEM-1380 for R-12 or OEM-1418 for HFC-134A) is a continuous loop recycling system in which the refrigerant is recycled until all the moisture and contaminants are removed ( Figure 21). The system recovers 1/2 lb. of refrigerant per minute and recycles 2-1/2 lbs. per minute.

The unit is programmed and operates through your manifold gauge set or charging station with a single connection hook-up. It is designed to automatically shut off on the recovery cycle and purge air from storage tanks to prevent pressure build up. A moisture indicator will change from yellow to green when recycling is complete.

Components include a heavy-duty, hermetically sealed compressor, maintenance-free oil separator/heat exchanger with calibrated waste oil bottle, 300-lb.-capacity refrigerant filter, three 72" color-coded "quick seal" hoses for R-12 systems, Metric SAE quick-disconnect fittings (with valves) for HFC-134A systems, and two 30-lb.-capacity, D.O.T. approved, reusable storage tanks.
